intro: Antidesma hosei var. microcarpum, commonly known as the small-fruited antidesma, is a shrub or small tree native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves that are usually elliptical or ovate in shape. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically yellowish-green, followed by small, fleshy fruits that are often red when mature. It thrives in humid, well-drained soils and is often found in secondary forests or along riverbanks. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation areas.
